Sequence Information.Peptide Name: wb-Moronecidin (white bass Moronecidin, natural AMPs; fish, animals; XXA, UCLL1c)

Literature Information.Literature: Similar to piscidin 2. It contains one additional T at the C-terminus.Activity: Active against Gram-positive S. aureus (MRSA), E. faecalis (anti-VRE) (MIC 5-10 uM), L. monocytogenes (MIC 2.5-5 uM), M. luteus (MIC 10-20 uM), S. epidermidis (MIC 5-10 uM), S. saprophiticus (MIC 5-10 uM), S. agalactiae (MIC 1.25-2.5 uM), S. bovis (MIC 1.25-2.5 uM), S. equisimilis (MIC 2.5-5 uM), S. mitis (MIC 1.25-2.5 uM), S. pneumoniae (MIC 1.25-2.5 uM), S. pyogenes (MIC 1.25-2.5 uM), S. iniae (MIC 1.25-2.5 uM), Gram-negative V. cholera (MIC 2.5-5 uM), E. coli (MIC 5-10 uM), E. cloacae (MIC 110-20 uM), E. aerogenes (MIC 10-20 uM), K. pneumoniae (MIC 2.5-5 uM), K. oxytoca (MIC 5-10 uM), M. catarrhalis (MIC 2.5-5 uM), P. aeruginosa (MIC 5-10 uM), S. choleraesuis (MIC 10-20 uM), S. typhimurium (MIC 10-20 uM), S-arizonae (MIC >20 uM), S. flexneri (MIC 2.5-5 uM), S. sonnei (MIC 5-10 uM), Y. enterocolitica (MIC 2.5-5 uM), filamentous fungi N. crassa (MIC 1.56-3.12 uM), A. fumigatus (MIC 50-100 uM), F. oxysporum (MIC 0.78-1.56 uM), F. culmorum (MIC 0.39-0.78 uM), yeast (MIC 10-20 uM), C. glabrata (MIC 10-20 uM), C. lusitania (MIC 10-20 uM), and C.  tropicalis (MIC 10-20 uM).Updated 12/2024
Literature Information.Author: Lauth X, Shike H, Burns JC, Westerman ME, Ostland VE, Carlberg JM, Van Olst JC, Nizet V, Taylor SW, Shimizu C, Bulet P.2002
Literature Information.Title: Discovery and characterization of two isoforms of moronecidin, a novel antimicrobial peptide from hybrid striped bass
